text:
Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name **])
   Assessment:
   Obtained pt on 6LNC and FT 100% fiO2, sats on these settings ~88%,
   breath sounds clear to right lung and dim to left, no Cxray this am, pt
   with increased confusion, orientedx1 consistant with previous
   assessment, unable to follow command without aggressive cues, unable to
   say last name or birth date, increasingly somulant
   Action:
   Pt placed on high flow neb at 95% fiO2, obtained vbg and abg, see
   flowsheet for objective data, pt with elevation in PCO2, sats at this
   time ~90% on high flow neb, attempted nasal bipap, not able to maintain
   sats on nasal bipap, started full mask, continued difficulties
   ventilating, pt increasingly lethargic during this time, HO contact[**Name (NI) **]
   pts HCP to confirm [**Name (NI) **], at 1400 intubated pt, AC 0.70/500/14/+8, Cxray,
   repeat abg obtained, tapped pleural effusions fluid sent to micro,
   post- procedure Cxray done
   Response:
   Ongoing,  tube placement confirmed by Cxray, breath sounds clear,
   maintaining sats on 70% fiO2
   Plan:
   f/u results of repeat ABG, if not improved and need for frequent ABGs ?
   need for a-line placement,, continue mechanical vent as needed with
   resolution of hypercarbia, f/u post thoracentisis xray, follow-up micro
   data
   Abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Pt with largely distended abd, no BM for several days, neg flatus,
   vague reports of abg pain
   Action:
   Pt given fleets enema with no effect, colace as ordered
   Response:
   No BM at this time
   Plan:
   Continue bowel regiment, increase as needed, ? placement of rectal tube
   for decompression if otherwise unable to resolve
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Obtained pt on dilt gtt 10mg/hr and amiodarone 200 mg po, NSR 70s no
   ectopy
   Action:
   d/c
d dilt gtt with no change in rate or rhythm noted, amiodarone
   d/c
d, pt ordered for qid lopressor for rate control, peri-intubation
   HR 50s-60s, post intubation HR 50s to mid 40s, consulted pharmacy about
   ?sedation in the setting of mental retardation (MR) of unknown
   etiology, continuing to monitor tele, holding lopressor for SB
   Response:
   Ongoing, pt remains of cardiac gtts, in NSR/SB
   Plan:
   f/u pharm recs, titrate sedation to hemodynamics and comfort, continue
   to monitor tele
